revised_title: On the Properties and Classification of Cystic Oxide
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, describes a new species of urinary calculus called cystic oxide. He discusses its properties, such as its resistance to water, alcohol, and acetic acid, and its solubility in other acids and alkaline substances. Wollaston also corrects inaccuracies in his previous work and shares observations on the uric acid excretion in birds with different diets.
